properties.entry: A two-character ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Country Code.
A geographic latitude in decimal degrees notation ranging between +90 and -90 degrees.
A geographic longitude in decimal degrees notation ranging between +180 and -180 degrees.
A encoded GIS query location, position or area.
Either the state FIPS code or USPS 2-character abbreviation.
A unique County identifier; defined as a concatenation of parent the state FIPS code (a two-character, zero padded integer) and the county FIPS code (a three-character, zero padded integer).
A unique USPS 2-character state abbreviation. e.g. "NE" for Nebraska. Not case sensitive.
A unique Census tract identifier; defined as a concatenation of the current state FIPS code, county FIPS code, and census tract code.
The county name. e.g. "Lancaster" for Lancaster County.
A radius distance, in meters.
The originating latitude in decimal degrees.
The originating longitude in decimal degrees.
The terminating latitude in decimal degrees.
The terminating longitude in decimal degrees.
A street address.
The EPSG Geodetic index code.
The desired elevation model.
The location feature name.
Any valid IPv4 or IPv6 numerical address.
A encoded GIS location, position or area.
A standard HTTP response.
